content.html:
Prior to this point, you have worked primarily with equations in one and two variables. In this lesson, you will shift your attention to inequalities. You will interpret, write, and find solutions to inequalities in one variable.

When you finish this lesson, you will be able to:

  • Write inequalities that represent the constraints in a situation.

Here are the activities that will help you reach those goals:

  • 2.7.1: Understanding Inequality Symbols
  • 2.7.2: Identifying Constraints in Inequalities
  • 2.7.2: Self Check
  • 2.7.3: Writing Inequalities to Represent Constraints
  • 2.7.3: Self Check
  • 2.7.4: Writing More Inequalities

After that, you’ll practice and review.

  • 2.7.5: Practice
  • 2.7.6: Lesson Summary
